Paul Ogbe (Enugu South Urban); Theresa Egbo (Enugu South Rural); Christopher Ugwu (Enugu East) | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 556 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | area_water_percent = | area_metro_km2 = | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_ft = 590 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 722,664 | population_as_of = 2006 census | population_rank = 9th | population_density_km2 = auto | population_urban = | population_est = | pop_est_as_of = | population_note = | population_blank1_title = | population_blank1 = | population_blank2_title = | population_blank2 = | timezone1 = WAT | utc_offset1 = +1 | postal_code_type = Postcode | postal_code = 400... | area_code = 042Williams, p. 87. | blank_name = Climate | blank_info = Aw | website = http://www.enugustate.gov.ng/ | footnotes = | official_name = }} Enugu ( ; ) is the capital of Enugu State in Nigeria. It is located in southeastern Nigeria. The city had a population of 722,664 in 2006. ==References== Category:Cities in Nigeria Category:State capitals in Nigeria Category:Enugu State
